name: src/Entity.js
Entity
description: The base-class of all entities described in the manifest.

name: createClass
description: Create a new `Entity` subclass with the given configuration.

params.name: config
params.description: a set of static properties for the new class

params.name: config.name
params.description: the name of the new class

return.description: a new subclass of `Entity`

name: hasInstance
description:
Test whether the given entity is an instance of this class.
This is a polymorphic check; call it on `Entity` subclasses.

params.name: entity
params.description: the entity to test

return.description: whether the given entity is an instance of this class

name: hasSubclass
description:
Test whether the given class is a subclass of this class.
This is a polymorphic check; call it on `Entity` subclasses.

params.name: otherClass
params.description: the class to test

return.description: whether the given class is subclass of this class

name: allSubclasses
description:
Returns all the subclasses of this class, both direct and indirect.
This is a polymorphic check; call it on `Entity` subclasses.

return.description: the set of subclasses of this class

name: [Symbol.hasInstance]
description: Overwriting the JavaScript `instanceof` operator to work with our improvised class hierarchy.

params.name: entity
params.description: the entity to test

return.description: whether the given entity is an instance of this class

name: new
description: Create a new entity of this (polymorphically determined) Entity subclass.

name: src/fields/Field.js
Field
description: A class that represents specific fields on an `Entity`.

name: augmentClass
description:
Equip an `Entity` subclass `cls` with its particular fields,
optionally only for a particular key.

params.name: cls
params.description: a subclass of `Entity` still under construction

params.name: onlyForKey
params.description: the only key for which to initialize the field

name: initializeEntity
description: Initialize the fields of a particular `Entity` instance.

params.name: owner
params.description: the entity to initialize

params.name: initialValues
params.description: the initial values for the entity's fields

params.name: valueTrackerOptions
params.description: the `ValueTracker` options to use for each field's observable properties

name: isEqual
description:
The function used for testing the values of this field for equality.
Can be overwritten by specific field classes (e.g., `Rel$Field`).

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - whether `a` and `b` are considered equal values

return.description: whether `a` and `b` are considered equal values

name: [Symbol.toStringTag]
description: Making this field recognizable when converted to a string.

return.description: a string like `Field: Lyph#name = "Heart"`

name: constructor
description: Create a new instance of this field on a specific entity.

params.name: options.owner
params.description: the entity on which to create this field

params.name: options.key
params.description: the key on that entity corresponding to this field

params.name: options.desc
params.description: the descriptor for what kind of field this is

params.name: options.aliases
params.description: other keys to which this field should answer

params.name: options.setValueThroughSignal
params.description: whether signals sent to `field.p('value')` should be accepted

params.name: options.valueTrackerOptions
params.description: the `ValueTracker` options to use for each field's observable properties

name: valueToJSON
description: Convert this field's value to JSON (plain data).

name: valueToJSON
description: How to properly convert a value in this field to JSON (plain data).

params.name: value
params.description: the value to convert to JSON

params.name: options.flattenFieldValues
params.description: whether `Object` or `Array` field values should be avoided in the output (for example, Neo4j does not accept nested objects)

name: jsonToValue
description: How to properly convert a JSON value to a value appropriate for this type of field.

params.name: json
params.description: the JSON value to convert

params.name: options.flattenFieldValues
params.description: whether field values are strings that should be run through `JSON.parse`

params.name: options.getEntity
params.description: a function that returns an entity corresponding to a given address

return.description: this field's value

name: set
description: Set this field to a new value.

params.name: newValue
params.description: the new value for this field

params.name: options.ignoreReadonly
params.description: allow this field's value to be changed even if it is read-only

params.name: options.ignoreValidation
params.description: don't validate the new value

name: validate
description:
Validate a certain value as appropriate for this field.
Throws an exception if the value is invalid. Otherwise does nothing.
Should be overwritten by specific `Field` subclasses.

params.name: val
params.description: the value to test

params.name: stages
params.description: the validation stages to validate for (e.g., 'commit')

name: src/fields/PropertyField.js
PropertyField
description: A field on an `Entity` representing a simple data-type.

name: initClass
description: Equip an `Entity` subclass `cls` with a particular property field.

params.name: options.cls
params.description: a subclass of `Entity` still under construction

params.name: options.key
params.description: the key for the field to put in

params.name: options.desc.readonly
params.description: whether this field should be read-only

name: constructor
description: Create a new instance of this field on a specific entity.

params.name: options.owner
params.description: the entity on which to create this field

params.name: options.key
params.description: the key on that entity corresponding to this field

params.name: options.desc
params.description: the descriptor for what kind of field this is

params.name: options.initialValue
params.description: the initial value for this field

params.name: options.aliases
params.description: other keys to which this field should answer

params.name: options.setValueThroughSignal
params.description: whether signals sent to `field.p('value')` should be accepted

params.name: options.valueTrackerOptions
params.description: the `ValueTracker` options to use for each field's observable properties

name: valueToJSON
description: How to properly convert a value in this field to JSON (plain data).

unknown.tagValue: {*} a plain-data value representing `value` that can go inside a JSON object

params.name: value
params.description: the value to convert to JSON

params.name: options.flattenFieldValues
params.description: whether `Object` or `Array` field values should be avoided in the output (for example, Neo4j does not accept nested objects)

return.description: a plain-data value representing `value` that can go inside a JSON object

name: jsonToValue
description: How to properly convert a JSON value to a value appropriate for this type of field.

params.name: json
params.description: the JSON value to convert

params.name: options.flattenFieldValues
params.description: whether field values are strings that should be run through `JSON.parse`

name: validate
description:
Validate a certain value as appropriate for this field.
Throws an exception if the value is invalid. Otherwise does nothing.

params.name: val
params.description: the value to test

params.name: stages
params.description: the validation stages to validate for (e.g., 'commit')

name: src/fields/Rel$Field.js
Rel$Field
description:
A field on an `Entity` representing the 'many'-side
of a many-to-many or many-to-one relationship.
Therefore, its value is always a `Set`.

name: initClass
description: Equip an `Entity` subclass `cls` with a particular property field.

params.name: options.cls
params.description: a subclass of `Entity` still under construction

params.name: options.key
params.description: the key for the field to put in

params.name: options.aliases
params.description: additional keys for this field

params.name: options.desc.readonly
params.description: whether this field should be read-only

name: constructor
description: Create a new instance of this field on a specific entity.

params.name: options.owner
params.description: the entity on which to create this field

params.name: options.key
params.description: the key on that entity corresponding to this field

params.name: options.desc
params.description: the descriptor for what kind of field this is

params.name: options.initialValue
params.description: the initial value for this field

params.name: options.aliases
params.description: other keys to which this field should answer

params.name: options.aliasInitialValues
params.description: other keys to which this field should answer

params.name: options.setValueThroughSignal
params.description: whether signals sent to `field.p('value')` should be accepted

params.name: options.valueTrackerOptions
params.description: the `ValueTracker` options to use for each field's observable properties

return.description:
A new `Set` data-structure populated with
              the entities in this field.

name: set
description: Set this field to a new collection of related entities.

params.name: newValue
params.description: the new collection of entities to be put in this field

params.name: options.ignoreReadonly
params.description: allow this field's value to be changed even if it is read-only

params.name: options.ignoreValidation
params.description: don't validate the new value

name: add
description: Add an additional entity to this field.

params.name: newSubValue
params.description: the new entity to be added into this field

params.name: options.ignoreReadonly
params.description: allow this field's value to be changed even if it is read-only

params.name: options.ignoreValidation
params.description: don't validate the new cardinality or value

name: delete
description: Remove a specific entity from this field.

params.name: subValue
params.description: the entity to be removed from this field

params.name: options.ignoreReadonly
params.description: allow this field's value to be changed even if it is read-only

params.name: options.ignoreValidation
params.description: don't validate the new cardinality

name: valueToJSON
description: How to properly convert a value in this field to JSON (plain data).

params.name: value
params.description: the value to convert to JSON

params.name: options.requireClass
params.description: the only `Entity` subclass accepted into the output, optionally

name: jsonToValue
description: How to properly convert a JSON value to a value appropriate for this type of field.

params.name: json
params.description: the JSON value to convert

params.name: options.getEntity
params.description: a function that returns an entity corresponding to a given address

name: validate
description:
Validate a certain value as appropriate for this field.
Throws an exception if the value is invalid. Otherwise does nothing.

params.name: val
params.description: the value to test

params.name: stages
params.description: the validation stages to validate for (e.g., 'commit')

name: validateCardinality
description:
Validate a certain cardinality as appropriate for this field.
Throws an exception if the cardinality is invalid. Otherwise does nothing.

params.name: cardinality
params.description: the cardinality to test

params.name: stages
params.description: the validation stages to validate for (e.g., 'commit')

name: validateElement
description:
Validate a specific entity as appropriate to be included in this field.
Throws an exception if the entity is invalid. Otherwise does nothing.

params.name: entity
params.description: the entity to test

params.name: stages
params.description: the validation stages to validate for (e.g., 'commit')

name: src/fields/Rel1Field.js
Rel1Field
description:
A field on an `Entity` representing the 'one'-side
of a one-to-one or one-to-many relationship.
Therefore, its value is always an `Entity` or `null`.

name: initClass
description: Equip an `Entity` subclass `cls` with a particular property field.

params.name: options.cls
params.description: a subclass of `Entity` still under construction

params.name: options.key
params.description: the key for the field to put in

params.name: options.aliases
params.description: additional keys for this field

params.name: options.desc.readonly
params.description: whether this field should be read-only

name: constructor
description: Create a new instance of this field on a specific entity.

params.name: options.owner
params.description: the entity on which to create this field

params.name: options.key
params.description: the key on that entity corresponding to this field

params.name: options.desc
params.description: the descriptor for what kind of field this is

params.name: options.initialValue
params.description: the initial value for this field

params.name: options.aliases
params.description: other keys to which this field should answer

params.name: options.aliasInitialValues
params.description: other keys to which this field should answer

params.name: options.setValueThroughSignal
params.description: whether signals sent to `field.p('value')` should be accepted

params.name: options.valueTrackerOptions
params.description: the `ValueTracker` options to use for each field's observable properties

return.description:
A new `Set` data-structure populated with
              the entity in this field, or empty.

name: add
description: Set this field to a new entity, removing the previous one.

params.name: newValue
params.description: the new entity to be put in this field

params.name: options.ignoreReadonly
params.description: allow this field's value to be changed even if it is read-only

params.name: options.ignoreValidation
params.description: don't validate the new cardinality or value

name: delete
description: Set this field to `null` if the given entity corresponds to the entity currently in this field.

params.name: oldValue
params.description: the entity to be removed from this field

params.name: options.ignoreReadonly
params.description: allow this field's value to be changed even if it is read-only

params.name: options.ignoreValidation
params.description: don't validate the new cardinality

name: valueToJSON
description: How to properly convert a value in this field to JSON (plain data).

params.name: value
params.description: the value to convert to JSON

params.name: options.requireClass
params.description: the only `Entity` subclass accepted for the output, optionally

name: jsonToValue
description: How to properly convert a JSON value to a value appropriate for this type of field.

params.name: json
params.description: the JSON value to convert

params.name: options.getEntity
params.description: a function that returns an entity corresponding to a given address

name: validate
description:
Validate a certain value as appropriate for this field.
Throws an exception if the value is invalid. Otherwise does nothing.

params.name: val
params.description: the value to test

params.name: stages
params.description: the validation stages to validate for (e.g., 'commit')

name: validateElement
description:
Validate a certain value as appropriate for this field.
Throws an exception if the value is invalid. Otherwise does nothing.

params.name: element
params.description: the value to test

params.name: stages
params.description: the validation stages to validate for (e.g., 'commit')

name: src/fields/RelField.js
RelField
description: A field on an `Entity` representing one side of a relationship.

return.description:
A new `Set` data-structure populated with
              the entities related through this field.

name: add
description: Add an additional entity to this field, or replace the current entity if this is a `Rel1Field`.

params.name: newValue
params.description: the new entity to be added into this field

params.name: options.ignoreReadonly
params.description: allow this field's value to be changed even if it is read-only

params.name: options.ignoreValidation
params.description: don't validate the new cardinality or value

name: delete
description: Remove a specific entity from this field.

params.name: oldValue
params.description: the entity to be removed from this field

params.name: options.ignoreReadonly
params.description: allow this field's value to be changed even if it is read-only

params.name: options.ignoreValidation
params.description: don't validate the new cardinality

name: validateElement
description:
Validate a specific entity as appropriate to be included in this field.
Throws an exception if the entity is invalid. Otherwise does nothing.

params.name: entity
params.description: the entity to test

params.name: stages
params.description: the validation stages to validate for (e.g., 'commit')

src/modules/TypedModule.js
TypedModule
description:
Typed Modules allow to more easily create related
Type, Template and HasType classes. For example,
to create LyphType and LyphTemplate resources and
their HasType relationship from one description.

src/util/ObservableSet.js
ObservableSet
description:
A data-structure with the same interface as `Set`,
and emits mutation events from rxjs streams.

name: constructor
description: Create a new instance of `ObservableSet`.

params.name: initialContent
params.description: initial elements to put in this set object

name: e
description: Get an event stream associated with this set object.

params.name: op
params.description: the name of the event stream you want: `"add"` or `"delete"`

return.description: the rxjs event stream

name: p
description: Get an event stream associated with this set object.

unknown.tagValue: {Observable} - the rxjs event stream (based on the `BehaviorSubject` class)

params.name: name
params.description:
the name of the property you want; the
                        only one available at the moment is `"value"`

return.description: the rxjs event stream (based on the `BehaviorSubject` class)

name: add
description: Add a new element with the given value to this set object.

params.name: val
params.description: the value to add to the set

return.description: this observable set object

name: clear
description: Remove all elements from this set object.

name: delete
description: Removes the element with the value and returns the value that `has(val)` would have previously returned.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - the element that was removed, if it existed; `false` otherwise

params.name: val
params.description: the value to remove

return.description: the element that was removed, if it existed; `false` otherwise

unknown.tagValue:
{Iterator<T[]>} - a new Iterator object that yields an array of
                             `[value, value]` for each element in this set object.

return.description:
a new Iterator object that yields an array of
                             `[value, value]` for each element in this set object.

name: forEach
description: Run a function for each element in this set object.

params.name: callbackFn
params.description: the function to invoke for each element

params.name: thisArg
params.description: the object that will be `this` inside the `callbackFn`

name: has
description: Test whether this set object contains a certain value.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} `true`, if `val` is an element in this set object; `false` otherwise

params.name: val
params.description: the value to test for

return.description: `true`, if `val` is an element in this set object; `false` otherwise

unknown.tagValue: {Iterator<T>} - a new Iterator object that contains the values for each element in this set object

return.description: a new Iterator object that contains the values for each element in this set object

name: [Symbol.iterator]
description: The presence of this method makes an observable set object iterable through `for...of` loops.

unknown.tagValue: {Iterator<T>} - a new Iterator object that contains the values for each element in this set object

return.description: a new Iterator object that contains the values for each element in this set object

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the number of values in this set object

return.description: the number of values in this set object

name: overwrite
description:
Overwrite the content of this set object,
emitting the proper `delete` and `add` signals (in that order).

params.name: newContent
params.description: the new elements of the set

return.description: this observable set object

name: src/util/misc.js
parseCardinality
description: Transform a string representation of a cardinality range into an object.

unknown.tagValue: {{min: number, max: number}} an object with `min` and `max` fields

params.name: cardinality
params.description:
{string} a string representation of minimum and maximum cardinality `"min..max"`,
                    where `min` is a natural number and `max` is a natural number greater or
                    equal to `min` or an asterisk symbol `*` to represent an unbounded maximum

return.description: an object with `min` and `max` fields

name: stringifyCardinality
description: Transform an object representation of a cardinality range into a representative string.

unknown.tagValue: {string} a string representing the given cardinality range, possibly collapsed if `min === max` and `abbreviate === true`

params.name: cardinality
params.description: {{min: number, max: number}} an object representation of minimum and maximum cardinality `{min, max}`

params.name: abbreviate
params.description: {boolean} whether or not to collapse the resulting string if `min === max`

return.description: a string representing the given cardinality range, possibly collapsed if `min === max` and `abbreviate === true`

name: setEquals
description: Compare two sets for equality.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} `true`, if both sets have the same elements; `false`, otherwise

params.name: setA
params.description: {Iterable<T>}

params.name: setB
params.description: {Iterable<T>}

return.description: `true`, if both sets have the same elements; `false`, otherwise

name: constraint
description:
Express an assertion that's tied to outside input.
We may later replace this with a more sophisticated mechanism.

params.name: constraint
params.description: the condition to check

params.name: message
params.description: the message to display if the condition fails
